channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-23088] Using Strings from log4j breaks non-log4j users
item.description:
HookUtils uses explicitly org.apache.logging.log4j.util.Strings class from log4j, but it may break clients who use other loggers and should exclude log4j from the classpath.

commons-lang has class StringUtils which may be used as a replacement for this one:
Strings.isBlank -> StringUtils.isBlank.
item.summary: Using Strings from log4j breaks non-log4j users

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hey volodymyr thanks for reporting this!
The method used in a couple of other places as well e.g.: HiveServer2, LlapWrappedAppender 
It would make sense to replace it all together.

Hi pgaref, agree, that's a good point!

Sorry for pointing to this place only, I haven't downloaded project sources yet, only found this place due to ClassNotFound exceptions when tried to update Hive version in Drill.

The main issue is from the fact that HookUtils is a public-facing class.

I'm leaving LlapWrappedAppender as is, as it's a log4j-based wrapper with a bunch of related classes already being used in it.

On branch-3 I've used the already imported StringUtils classes regardless of commons-lang 2v3, when present.

-1 overall
